articles.author: Jiraporn Kuhakan
articles.title: Thai elephants march in silence for Australian bushfires
articles.description: A troupe of elephants and school students held a silent march at a Thai elephant camp on Monday to pay their respects and raise awareness for the millions of animals killed in Australia's raging bushfires.
articles.content:
AYUTTHAYA, Thailand (Reuters) - A troupe of elephants and school students held a silent march at a Thai elephant camp on Monday to pay their respects and raise awareness for the millions of animals killed in Australia’s raging bushfires.

articles.title: Australian Smith wins Sony Open after playoff in Hawaii
articles.description: Cameron Smith won the PGA Tour's Sony Open in Hawaii on Sunday after the Australian made up a three-stroke deficit in the final round and then beat overnight leader Brendan Steele in a playoff.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Cameron Smith won the PGA Tour’s Sony Open in Hawaii on Sunday after the Australian made up a three-stroke deficit in the final round and then beat overnight leader Brendan Steele in a playoff.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Leader of Georgian breakaway region resigns after protests
articles.description: The leader of the Georgian breakaway region of Abkhazia tendered his resignation late on Sunday following days of protests, the president's office said.
articles.content:
MOSCOW (Reuters) - The leader of the Georgian breakaway region of Abkhazia tendered his resignation late on Sunday following days of protests, the president’s office said.

articles.description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Co (ADNOC) grew its renewable energy portfolio by more than 400% in the last 10 years, and is on track to double that again in the coming decade, chief executive Sultan al-Jaber said on Monday.

articles.author: Jiraporn Kuhakan
articles.title: Thailand helps sea turtle swim again with prosthetic flippers
articles.description: Thai turtle Goody lost her left flipper years ago after she was entangled in a fishing net, leaving her immobile and stressed out in captivity.
articles.content:
PHUKET, Thailand (Reuters) - Thai turtle Goody lost her left flipper years ago after she was entangled in a fishing net, leaving her immobile and stressed out in captivity.

articles.author: Noah Browning
articles.title: RPT-I'm a scapegoat: Angola's Isabel dos Santos decries corruption 'witch hunt'
articles.description: Angolan billionaire and former first daughter Isabel Dos Santos decried a New Year's Eve court order to freeze her vast assets as a "witch hunt" engineered to weaken her father's influence and distract from economic failures.
articles.content:

articles.description: Beltone Financial, one of the biggest financial corporations in Egypt, plans to expand to Gulf and African countries in 2020, its chief executive told Reuters.

articles.title: Guinea-Bissau Supreme Court rejects challenge to presidential election result
articles.description: Guinea-Bissau's Supreme Court on Sunday rejected a challenge against Umaro Cissoko Embalo's victory in last month's election run-off by the defeated candidate, who complained of fraud.
articles.content:
BISSAU (Reuters) - Guinea-Bissau’s Supreme Court on Sunday rejected a challenge against Umaro Cissoko Embalo’s victory in last month’s election run-off by the defeated candidate, who complained of fraud.
